97921
60/30 FPS Gameplay Animations This mod allows the game to run on a higher FPS than the original. It contains two possible modes: - Full 60 FPS: This bumps up the FPS to 60 for battle, field, and world mode. - Full 30 FPS: This bumps up the FPS to 30 for battle mode The mod contains 3D model interpolated animations (battle character models, battle enemy models, field character models, ...) except world character models (unnecessary), chocobo mode models, submarine mode models and highway mode models.
If you are playing FF7 without any gameplay mods, make sure to set the fix field script mode for 60 FPS in the mod settings.

0 Hardcore Mod Gameplay Basically boosts the game difficulty. This mod mainly strives to refresh the gameplay by sticking to the original settings, BUT it also tweaks some enemy AI, spell effect, equipments, etc, for different reasons. For instance, there are quite a few bugs in the AI and field scripts. Most of these have been fixed. Also, many equipments, spells and enemy skills are useless, gets obsolete and/or are overpowered or cheap. Thus some equipments and attack effects are tweaked in an attempt to balance things out. With the above said, keep in mind things have been kept as close to the original as possible while refreshing the gameplay. For those of you that don't want a new FF7, but want a refreshed, more difficult FF7.
gjoerulv Gameplay Difficulty

Shinra Archaeology Cut Gameplay This mod does the double duty of retranslating the entire game script from the ground up directly from the original Japanese—taking care to conform with modern Square Enix localization choices for FFVII—as well as optionally restoring the vast majority of the game's unused content. Also offers a bevy of optional bonus features in the config settings.

## MEDIA ##
## MU80 Soundtrack
91119111-9de5-43fc-922f-9d92ed8fb322 MU80 Soundtrack Raymond, Template Media -This is a Final Fantasy 7 soundtrack mod featuring the original XG MIDI data from the 1998 PC release, as rendered through a rackmount Yamaha MU80 sound module (closest hardware equivalent of the original S-YXG70 software synthesizer). It is perhaps the best possible 1:1 expression of the game's original music data using a single sample set--in this case, the XG extended midi soundbank offered by the MU80. -2 options for the track "One-Winged Angel" (lb2) are included--1 with and 1 without vocal choir. -Credit and a debt of gratitude go to Raymond from the old SE forums for the original recordings. -Additional authors: NidoLNorris, Dte102 (opening sfx)

WereXIII Gameplay
IMPORTANT = This Mod must be placed at the top. This project was a long immense project. This project has been unreal. It started June 23rd 2014 and took 3 months. This mod replaces Red XIII, a quadruped Lionish with a full blown kick-ass Lycanthrope. This mod includes the battle model, field model, custom animations, 7 limit breaks, avatar and all casting animations. A lot of people have had hands in on this and I really appreciate it. If you find any problems or bugs or ideas on animation tweaks let me know. :::Thanks:::to those who worked directly on the project and especially CMH175, who I feel ended up more as a co producer than someone who assisted. CMH175 Leet Jeet Kaldarasha EQ2Alyza Kuroda Jusete And everyone who had suggestions and pointers. And all of the creators of the tools that were used for the project.
